Pre-Game Insights: England and Scotland's rivalry in cricket dates back to 1870, with their first official meeting in 2008.
The match is the sixth T20 meeting between the two teams, following five ODIs including a notable 2018 encounter where Scotland scored 371/5 in response to England's 298/9.
England's captain Jos Buttler is in strong form, while Scotland has a strong squad with recent success in qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is part of the 2024 T20 World Cup, with England aiming to defend their title and Scotland seeking to leverage their underdog status.
The Kensington Oval in Barbados, used for this match, has a slow and sticky surface which may favor Scotland's spinners.
Others: The match is significant for Jofra Archer, who will play in front of his home island for the first time in an international match.
